metadata.title: CVE-2017-9755 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
opcodes/i386-dis.c in GNU Binutils 2.28 does not consider the number ofregisters for bnd mode, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (buffer overflow and application crash) or possibly haveunspecified other impact via a crafted binary file, as demonstrated bymishandling of this file during "objdump -D" execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9755` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.29-1ubuntu1
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.29-1ubuntu1
binutils-alpha-linux-gnu - 2.29-1ubuntu1
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabi - 2.29-1ubuntu1
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabihf - 2.29-1ubuntu1
binutils-common - 2.29-1ubuntu1
binutils-for-build - 2.29-1ubuntu1
binutils-for-host - 2.29-1ubuntu1
binutils-hppa-linux-gnu - 2.29-1ubuntu1
binutils-hppa64-linux-gnu - 2.29-1ubuntu1
binutils-i686-linux-gnu - 2.29-1ubuntu1
binutils-m68k-linux-gnu - 2.29-1ubuntu1
binutils-mips-linux-gnu - 2.29-1ubuntu1
binutils-mips64-linux-gnuabi64 - 2.29-1ubuntu1
binutils-mips64-linux-gnuabin32 - 2.29-1ubuntu1
binutils-mips64el-linux-gnuabi64 - 2.29-1ubuntu1
binutils-mips64el-linux-gnuabin32 - 2.29-1ubuntu1
binutils-mipsel-linux-gnu - 2.29-1ubuntu1
binutils-multiarch - 2.29-1ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc-linux-gnu - 2.29-1ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc-linux-gnuspe - 2.29-1ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc64-linux-gnu - 2.29-1ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc64le-linux-gnu - 2.29-1ubuntu1
binutils-s390x-linux-gnu - 2.29-1ubuntu1
binutils-sh4-linux-gnu - 2.29-1ubuntu1
binutils-source - 2.29-1ubuntu1
binutils-sparc64-linux-gnu - 2.29-1ubuntu1
binutils-x86-64-linux-gnu - 2.29-1ubuntu1
libbinutils - 2.29-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: binutils package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.29-1ubuntu1').
